pages.Title: Sign Posts
pages.Description: Eyes open 1-4 second meditations.
pages.Body:
[[Bashars Teachings]] [[Awareness Tools]]
  • Signpost 1: Proprioception – Body Awareness
    Purpose: Build a foundational awareness of your body's boundaries and connect with present sensations.
    Typical Sensations: Feeling of heaviness, warmth, or awareness of your body's edges.
    Activation: Close your eyes and say "Signpost 1" in your mind. Picture a blue signpost with the number 1. Feel the outline of your body and notice any sensations. It's like doing a quick mental scan from head to toe.
    Deactivation: Let your awareness soften and imagine it expanding beyond your body, like a gentle ripple.
    Recommended Book: The Body Keeps the Score by Bessel van der Kolk (2014)
  • Signpost 2: Interoception – Breathing and Heart Center
    Purpose: Develop an understanding of your natural breath and connect to your heart center.
    Typical Sensations: Feeling the rise and fall of your chest, warmth in the chest area.
    Activation: Focus on the natural flow of breath, inhale deeply and slowly, feeling expansion in the heart area, and exhale fully, cultivating warmth and openness in the chest.
    Deactivation: Let go of controlled breathing, observe the breath as it flows naturally, and allow the warmth from the heart to radiate outward gently.
    Recommended Book: Breath: The New Science of a Lost Art by James Nestor (2020)
  • Signpost 3: Interoception – Solar Plexus Center
    Purpose: Foster self-confidence, energy, and a sense of personal power.
    Typical Sensations: A sense of energy or buzzing, warmth, expansion, or contraction in the upper abdomen.
    Activation: Focus awareness on the solar plexus, inhale deeply, feeling energy building in the upper abdomen, exhale slowly, maintaining awareness of warmth and confidence.
    Deactivation: Release awareness downward, visualizing energy gently spreading throughout the body, grounding yourself.
    Recommended Book: The Anatomy of the Spirit by Caroline Myss (1996)
  • Signpost 4: Interoception – Gut Center (Core Awareness)
    Purpose: Connect with instinctual responses, grounding, and stability.
    Typical Sensations: Heaviness, warmth, subtle tension, movement in the lower abdomen.
    Activation: Direct attention to the area below the navel. Inhale deeply into the abdomen, feeling expansion, engaging the diaphragm; exhale to release, cultivating a sense of deep stability and grounding.
    Deactivation: Allow awareness to settle, visualizing energy grounding down through the feet into the earth.
    Recommended Book: Core Awareness by Liz Koch (2012)
  • Signpost 5: Interoception – Pelvic Center
    Purpose: Anchor awareness into the foundation, connect with creativity and primal energy.
    Typical Sensations: Heaviness, warmth, pulsation, stability, or subtle movement.
    Activation: Bring awareness to the pelvic area, inhale to sense subtle expansion and creative energy, exhale while maintaining a sense of support from the ground.
    Deactivation: Allow energy to spread outward into the legs and feet, releasing any tension held in the pelvic area.
    Recommended Book: Waking the Tiger: Healing Trauma by Peter A. Levine (1997)
  • Signpost 6: Proprioception – Lower Body (Legs and Feet)
    Purpose: Deepen grounding and physical stability, foster awareness of lower body movement.
    Typical Sensations: Contact with the ground, heaviness, pressure, stability, energy moving through the legs.
    Activation: Direct awareness into your legs and feet, feeling your connection with the ground. Inhale deeply, sensing the contact points, and exhale while feeling grounded and stable.
    Deactivation: Visualize releasing tension downwards through the feet into the earth, letting go of heaviness.
    Recommended Book: The Endless Web: Fascial Anatomy and Physical Reality by R. Louis Schultz and Rosemary Feitis (1996)
  • Signpost 7: Exteroception – Skin and Surface Awareness
    Purpose: Expand awareness beyond the internal body to the skin’s surface, sensing external contact.
    Typical Sensations: Tingling, warmth, sensation of air against the skin, pressure, or touch.
    Activation: Direct attention to the skin, noticing sensations like temperature or contact. Inhale and feel these sensations expanding along the surface of your body.
    Deactivation: Gradually allow attention to soften, letting awareness withdraw inward, focusing instead on deeper sensations.
    Recommended Book: Touching: The Human Significance of the Skin by Ashley Montagu (1986)
  • Signpost 8: Proprioception – Upper Body (Arms and Shoulders)
    Purpose: Connect with movement and awareness of the upper body, releasing tension and fostering fluidity.
    Typical Sensations: Heaviness, lightness, movement, relaxation, or subtle tension in the shoulders and arms.
    Activation: Focus awareness on your arms and shoulders. Inhale, feeling any tension there, and exhale, allowing the shoulders to relax and arms to become lighter.
    Deactivation: Visualize the shoulders softening and tension flowing down through the arms, releasing out of the fingertips.
    Recommended Book: The Relaxation Response by Herbert Benson (1975)
  • Signpost 9: Interoception – Head and Forehead Center (Mind’s Eye)
    Purpose: Foster mental clarity, inner vision, and awareness of thoughts.
    Typical Sensations: Tingling, coolness, lightness, subtle pressure at the forehead or between the eyebrows.
    Activation: Shift focus to the forehead area or "mind’s eye." Inhale, drawing energy up to this point, and exhale, expanding awareness across the forehead, creating a sense of spaciousness.
    Deactivation: Let awareness soften, allowing energy to descend back to the heart or chest, bringing calmness and grounding.
    Recommended Book: The Mind Illuminated by John Yates, PhD (2015)
  • Signpost 10: Interoception – Crown and Above
    Purpose: Connect to expanded consciousness and a sense of interconnectedness.
    Typical Sensations: Tingling, lightness, subtle vibration, or expansion above the head.
    Activation: Focus awareness at the top of the head, visualizing light or energy expanding upwards, inhaling to connect with a sense of openness.
    Deactivation: Allow awareness to gently return down into the body, resting at the heart or abdomen, feeling re-centered.
    Recommended Book: The Untethered Soul by Michael A. Singer (2007)
  • Signpost 1: Proprioception – Body Awareness
    Purpose: Build a foundational awareness of your body's boundaries and connect with present sensations.
    Typical Sensations: Feeling of heaviness, warmth, or awareness of your body's edges.
    Activation: Close your eyes and say "Signpost 1" in your mind. Picture a blue signpost with the number 1. Feel the outline of your body and notice any sensations. It's like doing a quick mental scan from head to toe.
    Deactivation: Let your awareness soften and imagine it expanding beyond your body, like a gentle ripple.
    Recommended Book: The Body Keeps the Score by Bessel van der Kolk (2014)
  • Signpost 11: Inner Sound – Tuning into Silence and Resonance
    Purpose: Foster awareness of inner auditory sensations and resonance within.
    Typical Sensations: Vibration, deep stillness, a hum or pulse-like sensation, sense of spaciousness.
    Activation: Focus on inner silence, listening beyond external sounds to any faint resonance or rhythm within. Inhale, amplifying the quietness, and exhale, letting it expand.
    Deactivation: Release focus, allowing the sense of silence to gently recede, letting awareness move outward.
    Recommended Book: The Power of Silence by Carlos Castaneda (1987)
  • Signpost 12: Peripheral Vision – Awareness Beyond Sight
    Purpose: Broaden mental perception by shifting attention to the edges of your field of vision.
    Typical Sensations: Softness around the eyes, expanded awareness, gentle lightness in the head.
    Activation: Relax your gaze, paying attention to peripheral vision without shifting focus. Inhale to deepen this awareness, sensing beyond your immediate surroundings.
    Deactivation: Close or soften your eyes, allowing awareness to rest inward.
    Recommended Book: Vision for Life by Meir Schneider (2012)
  • Signpost 13: Energy Field – Beyond the Body’s Boundary
    Purpose: Extend awareness to the space around you, feeling into the energy field just beyond the skin.
    Typical Sensations: Subtle tingling, light pressure, warmth in an area around your body.
    Activation: Visualize a soft glow around your body, inhaling to connect with this surrounding space, and exhaling, letting it gently expand.
    Deactivation: Allow focus to return inward, feeling centered and contained.
    Recommended Book: The Energy Body by Tenzin Wangyal Rinpoche (2011)
  • Signpost 14: Heart Space – Emotional Center
    Purpose: Cultivate compassion, empathy, and emotional balance.
    Typical Sensations: Warmth, openness, lightness in the chest area.
    Activation: Direct your awareness to the heart center, inhaling deeply, feeling warmth expanding, and exhaling, letting emotions flow naturally.
    Deactivation: Soften focus, allowing warmth to gently dissipate and your awareness to expand outward.
    Recommended Book: The HeartMath Solution by Doc Childre and Howard Martin (2000)
  • Signpost 15: Crown – Connection to Higher Awareness
    Purpose: Expand awareness to a sense of higher consciousness or connection beyond self.
    Typical Sensations: Lightness, tingling, or a subtle upward pull at the top of the head.
    Activation: Focus on the crown of your head, imagining light or energy reaching upward. Inhale deeply to feel a sense of expansion.
    Deactivation: Gradually draw awareness back down, grounding into the body.
    Recommended Book: The Power of Now by Eckhart Tolle (1997)
  • Signpost 16: Inner Child – Connection with Innocence and Joy
    Purpose: Connect with a sense of playfulness, wonder, and joy.
    Typical Sensations: Lightness, happiness, warmth, or softness in the chest.
    Activation: Recall a joyful memory or imagine a playful scene. Inhale, allowing a sense of joy to expand in your chest.
    Deactivation: Let the memory fade, grounding back into the present.
    Recommended Book: Awakening Your Inner Child by Thich Nhat Hanh (1998)
  • Signpost 17: Core Intuition – Gut Feelings and Instinct
    Purpose: Tune into gut instincts and core intuition.
    Typical Sensations: Heaviness, tingling, deep calmness in the abdominal area.
    Activation: Focus on the gut area, inhaling to feel any instinctual pulls, exhaling to center these feelings.
    Deactivation: Allow awareness to expand outward from the gut, distributing calmness throughout.
    Recommended Book: The Gift of Fear by Gavin de Becker (1997)
  • Signpost 18: Throat – Expression and Communication
    Purpose: Enhance self-expression and communication, aligning with inner truth.
    Typical Sensations: Warmth, tingling, openness in the throat area.
    Activation: Focus on the throat, inhaling deeply, sensing any restrictions, and exhaling to release tension. Imagine expressing yourself freely.
    Deactivation: Let awareness soften, allowing any openness to radiate down the body.
    Recommended Book: The Artist's Way by Julia Cameron (1992)
  • Signpost 19: Hands – Connection to Action and Creation
    Purpose: Awaken awareness of the hands as instruments of creation and action.
    Typical Sensations: Tingling, warmth, pulsation, or lightness in the hands.
    Activation: Focus on the hands, feeling energy flow into your fingertips. Inhale deeply, imagining creation through touch.
    Deactivation: Gradually release focus, allowing awareness to soften and spread outward.
    Recommended Book: The Power of Touch by Tiffany Field (2001)
  • Signpost 20: Feet – Grounding and Stability
    Purpose: Enhance grounding and stability, connecting deeply with the Earth.
    Typical Sensations: Heaviness, pressure, warmth, or stability in the feet.
    Activation: Focus on the soles of your feet, imagining roots growing into the ground. Inhale, feeling connected and stable, exhale to anchor further.
    Deactivation: Release focus, allowing awareness to rise gently up through the body.
    Recommended Book: Earthing: The Most Important Health Discovery Ever? by Clinton Ober, Stephen Sinatra, and Martin Zucker (2010)

pages.Title: Awareness Tools
pages.Description: Various tools to help you train your focus, awareness, perception.
pages.Body:
[[Monroe Institute Focus Levels]]
  • 1. Body and Somatic Awareness
    • Basic Body Awareness: Focusing on physical sensations like breathing or muscle tension. This practice can help bring awareness to the present moment, reduce stress, and increase overall well-being.
    • Proprioception: Awareness of body positioning and movement in space, useful for grounding. Practices like yoga, Tai Chi, and balance exercises can enhance proprioception.
    • Interoception: Sensing internal body states (hunger, thirst, emotions). Cultivating interoception can lead to improved emotional regulation and body-mind harmony.
    • Kinesthetic Awareness: Mindfulness of movements, common in activities like Tai Chi, dance, or martial arts. This helps in integrating mental focus with physical action.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • HeartMath’s Quick Coherence Technique - Aligns heart, mind, and emotions for stress reduction.
    • Yoga and Tai Chi - Enhance proprioception and kinesthetic awareness through mindful movement.
    • Body Scan Meditation - Improves interoception by systematically focusing on different body parts.
  • 2. Sensory Awareness
    • Single Sensory Focus: Directing attention to a specific sense (sight, sound, etc.). This can be helpful for reducing anxiety by anchoring oneself in sensory experiences.
    • Broad Sensory Awareness: Expanding perception to all sensory inputs simultaneously, creating a sense of connection and openness with the surrounding environment.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • Mindfulness Meditation - Focuses on single or multiple senses to enhance present-moment awareness.
    • 5-4-3-2-1 Technique - A grounding exercise that engages all five senses to reduce anxiety.
    • Sound Bath Sessions - Utilize broad sensory awareness through immersive auditory experiences.
  • 3. Mental and Emotional Awareness
    • Thought Observing: Observing thoughts without attachment, often referred to as mindfulness meditation. This aligns with Carol Dweck's concept of a growth mindset by reducing reactivity to negative thoughts.
    • Emotional Body Scanning: Noticing and allowing emotions without judgment. This technique is used in practices like body scan meditations to enhance emotional intelligence and acceptance.
    • Mental Imagery: Vivid visualization used for creative and emotional exploration, such as Cal Newport's concept of deep work to achieve focused and meaningful outcomes.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • Cal Newport’s Deep Work - Focused, uninterrupted work sessions to enhance mental clarity and productivity.
    • Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) - Programs that incorporate thought observing and emotional body scanning.
    • Visualization Exercises - Techniques used in sports psychology and creative fields to harness mental imagery.
  • 4. Internal Dialogue and Self-Talk
    • Voice Awareness: Recognizing internal dialogue as separate and non-reactive, promoting distance from automatic thoughts.
    • Affirmative Focus: Replacing critical thoughts with positive affirmations, fostering a healthier mindset. This can be connected to the power of affirmations and neuroplasticity in reshaping habitual thinking patterns.
    • Intention Setting: Establishing intentions as mental guideposts for practice, which aligns with the Pomodoro technique for focusing on specific, timed goals.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • Affirmations - Positive statements repeated to encourage a positive mindset.
    • Pomodoro Technique - Time management method that sets clear intentions and focuses on specific tasks within timed intervals.
    • Journaling - Writing down internal dialogues and setting intentions for self-improvement.
  • 5. Environmental Awareness
    • Field Awareness: Perceiving the entire environment without focusing on any particular point. This can be helpful for relaxing the mind and entering into a meditative state.
    • Situational Awareness: Being mindful of the spatial layout, people, and objects, often used in high-performance activities such as martial arts or emergency response.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • Time Blocking - Organizing your environment and schedule to dedicate specific time slots for different activities.
    • Environmental Scanning - Regularly assessing and adjusting your workspace to optimize for productivity and awareness.
    • Situational Drills - Practices used in emergency response training to enhance situational awareness.
  • 6. Expanded Consciousness States
    • Presence Awareness: Focusing solely on being, rather than thinking, creating a connection to Maslow's concept of peak experiences where an individual feels a heightened sense of self-awareness.
    • Observer Self: Detaching the observing self from the experiencer, providing a perspective that reduces emotional reactivity.
    • Transpersonal Awareness: Feeling a deep connection with others or the universe, which aligns with Maslow's idea of self-transcendence.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • Meditation Practices - Techniques like Vipassana and Transcendental Meditation to achieve presence and observer states.
    • Lucid Dreaming - Techniques to become aware within dreams, fostering transpersonal awareness.
    • Peak Experience Exercises - Activities designed to elicit Maslow’s peak experiences and self-transcendence.
  • 7. Concentration and Meditative Focus
    • Single-Pointed Focus: Concentrating on a single sensation or object, such as the breath. This is similar to the Pomodoro technique, where focused periods lead to enhanced productivity.
    • Open Awareness: Letting awareness rest without a focal object, as practiced in certain Zen meditations.
    • Contemplative States: Engaging deeply with questions, concepts, or themes, fostering insights and understanding.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • Pomodoro Technique - Enhances single-pointed focus through timed work intervals.
    • Zen Meditation - Practices that promote open awareness and contemplative states.
    • Focused Attention Meditation - Techniques that train concentration on specific objects or thoughts.
  • 8. Altered States Techniques
    • Hypnagogic State: The state between waking and sleeping, useful for creative exploration, often cited by artists and inventors as a source of inspiration.
    • Lucid Dreaming: Bringing awareness into the dream state, allowing for conscious exploration of subconscious material.
    • Astral or Out-of-Body Awareness: Perceived separation from the physical body, explored in esoteric traditions for expanded self-knowledge.

    Techniques and Tools:
    • Lucid Dreaming Techniques - Practices like reality checks and dream journaling to achieve awareness within dreams.
    • Hypnagogic Exercises - Methods to explore the hypnagogic state for creative insights.
    • Astral Projection Practices - Techniques from esoteric traditions to experience out-of-body awareness.

pages.Title: Monroe Institute Focus Levels
pages.Description: A list of the focus levels...
pages.Body:
A list of the focus levels mentioned on the Monroe Institute Website. [[Consciousness Speedrunning]]

  • Focus Level 1 - Physical Awareness
    Color: Blue
    Geometry: Horizontal
    Focal Point: No specific point; focus on body sensations
    Perception Levels: Exteroception, Proprioception
    Body Schema Activation: Whole Body Schema (grounded presence)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel fully present in the moment, aware of surroundings.
    • Your body will feel: Grounded, with a sense of weight and presence.
    • Your mind will feel: Focused, engaged with your environment.
    Intention: Fully engage with the physical sensory experience.
    Affirmation: "I am here."
  • Focus Level 2 - Attachment and Reflection
    Color: Red
    Geometry: Horizontal
    Focal Point: Heart Center
    Perception Levels: Interoception, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Chest and Heart Schema (emotional center)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: Connected to memories or emotional stories.
    • Your body will feel: Warm or pulsating in the chest.
    • Your mind will feel: Reflective, aware of inner attachments.
    Intention: Observe personal attachments and emotional responses.
    Affirmation: "I feel deeply."
  • Focus Level 3 - Balance and Integration
    Color: Yellow
    Geometry: Horizontal
    Focal Point: Third Eye
    Perception Levels: Interoception, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Head and Forehead Schema (mental clarity)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel a balanced, calm alignment.
    • Your body will feel: Centered, with warmth at the forehead.
    • Your mind will feel: Clear, focused, and stable.
    Intention: Achieve inner harmony and mental clarity.
    Affirmation: "I am balanced."
  • Focus Level 4 - Healing and Guidance
    Color: Rose
    Geometry: Vertical
    Focal Point: Heart Center
    Perception Levels: Interoception, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Chest and Heart Schema (emotional healing)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel a gentle release of emotional tension.
    • Your body will feel: Warm and open in the heart area.
    • Your mind will feel: Compassionate, calm, and receptive.
    Intention: Engage in self-healing and open to guidance.
    Affirmation: "I welcome healing."
  • Focus Level 5 - Grounding and Application
    Color: Green
    Geometry: Horizontal
    Focal Point: Heart Center or Lower Abdomen
    Perception Levels: Proprioception, Interoception
    Body Schema Activation: Lower Abdomen and Heart Schema (stability and integration)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel grounded and centered.
    • Your body will feel: Solid, with a gentle weight in the abdomen or warmth in the heart.
    • Your mind will feel: Clear, stable, and ready to apply new insights.
    Intention: Integrate and apply personal growth practically.
    Affirmation: "I am grounded."
  • Focus Level 6 - Expansion and Creativity
    Color: Purple
    Geometry: Ascending Ellipse
    Focal Point: Third Eye or Crown
    Perception Levels: Diffuse Awareness, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Head and Crown Schema (creativity and intuition)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: Ideas flow freely, and inspiration feels boundless.
    • Your body will feel: Light and open around the third eye or crown.
    • Your mind will feel: Creative, expansive, and receptive to new possibilities.
    Intention: Explore novel ideas and perspectives.
    Affirmation: "I expand freely."
  • Focus Level 7 - Transcendence and Integration
    Color: White
    Geometry: Full circle
    Focal Point: Diffuse Awareness
    Perception Levels: Diffuse Awareness, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Whole Body Schema (unity and integration)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel whole, as if all aspects of self are integrated.
    • Your body will feel: Light and cohesive, as if connected to a larger field.
    • Your mind will feel: Calm, unified, and at peace.
    Intention: Embrace unity and holistic self-integration.
    Affirmation: "I am whole."
  • Focus Level 8 - Rebalance of Inner and Outer Worlds
    Color: Blue
    Geometry: Horizontal
    Focal Point: Heart Center and Third Eye (Alternate)
    Perception Levels: Interoception, Exteroception, Proprioception
    Body Schema Activation: Heart and Head Schema (balance between inner and outer)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel balanced between inner emotions and outer experiences.
    • Your body will feel: Harmonized, with warmth in the heart and focus in the head.
    • Your mind will feel: Peaceful and connected to both internal and external worlds.
    Intention: Balance internal awareness with outer experience.
    Affirmation: "I am balanced."
  • Focus Level 9 - Foundational Identity
    Color: Red
    Geometry: Horizontal
    Focal Point: Lower Abdomen
    Perception Levels: Proprioception, Interoception
    Body Schema Activation: Lower Abdomen Schema (stability and self-identity)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel strongly grounded in who you are.
    • Your body will feel: Solid, with a sense of strength and stability in the abdomen.
    • Your mind will feel: Clear, secure, and focused on core values.
    Intention: Reinforce identity and core values.
    Affirmation: "I am secure."
  • Focus Level 10 - Mind Awake, Body Asleep
    Color: Green
    Geometry: Descending
    Focal Point: Third Eye
    Perception Levels: Diffuse Awareness, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Forehead Schema (visualization and introspection)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: Your body feels at rest while your mind is alert.
    • Your body will feel: Heavy, relaxed, almost detached.
    • Your mind will feel: Open, calm, and receptive to inner imagery.
    Intention: Engage in deep meditation and introspection.
    Affirmation: "I am open."
  • Focus Level 11 - Healing and Reintegration
    Color: Rose
    Geometry: Vertical
    Focal Point: Body and Spirit Connection
    Perception Levels: Interoception, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Whole Body Schema (healing and harmony)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: Calm, gentle energy flows through your body.
    • Your body will feel: Relaxed with a healing warmth or soft light.
    • Your mind will feel: Receptive, calm, and connected.
    Intention: Reintegrate parts of self for holistic healing.
    Affirmation: "I am whole."
  • Focus Level 12 - Expanded Awareness and Problem Solving
    Color: Green
    Geometry: Vertical descending
    Focal Point: Outward and Inward Awareness
    Perception Levels: Diffuse Awareness, Exteroception
    Body Schema Activation: Upper Body and Head Schema (expanded mental awareness)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel connected to a larger field of possibilities.
    • Your body will feel: Broad and spacious around the head.
    • Your mind will feel: Open, insightful, and intuitive.
    Intention: Explore options and outcomes for solutions.
    Affirmation: "I am open."
  • Focus Level 13 - Transcendence of Current Skills
    Color: Purple
    Geometry: Ascending Ellipse
    Focal Point: Third Eye and Crown
    Perception Levels: Interoception, Diffuse Awareness
    Body Schema Activation: Head and Crown Schema (creativity and expansion)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You gain breakthroughs and feel potential unlocking.
    • Your body will feel: Lightness around the head and elevated.
    • Your mind will feel: Clear, creative, and ready for mastery.
    Intention: Master current skills and access new capacities.
    Affirmation: "I transcend limits."
  • Focus Level 14 - Awareness of Collective Consciousness
    Color: White
    Geometry: Full circle
    Focal Point: Diffuse Awareness
    Perception Levels: Diffuse Awareness, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Whole Body Schema (unity and collective awareness)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel connected with a larger, collective field.
    • Your body will feel: Light and expansive, sensing others.
    • Your mind will feel: Unified and aligned with larger consciousness.
    Intention: Embrace collective understanding and connectivity.
    Affirmation: "We are one."
  • Focus Level 15 - Timelessness and Deep Intuition
    Color: Blue
    Geometry: Horizontal
    Focal Point: Third Eye and Crown
    Perception Levels: Diffuse Awareness, Neuroception
    Body Schema Activation: Upper Body and Head Schema (timelessness and intuition)
    Experience:
    • You know you’re here when: You feel a sense of wisdom beyond time.
    • Your body will feel: Calm spaciousness, almost timeless.
    • Your mind will feel: Insightful, clear, and deeply intuitive.
    Intention: Access deep intuition and insight beyond time.
    Affirmation: "I trust wisdom."

pages.Title: Map of consiousness
pages.Description: Map of Consiousness...
pages.Body:
[[Monroe Institute Focus Levels]] [[Awareness Tools]] [[Sign Posts]] # Map of Consciousness by David R Hawkins:
  • Level 20: Shame
    Emotion: Humiliation
    Life View: Miserable
    Description: Characterized by feelings of humiliation and a sense of worthlessness. Individuals may experience self-loathing and a desire to hide.
    Recommended Action: Seek supportive environments and professional help to rebuild self-esteem.
    Reference: Power vs. Force by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 30: Guilt
    Emotion: Blame
    Life View: Evil
    Description: Dominated by feelings of blame and self-recrimination. Individuals may dwell on past actions and feel unworthy.
    Recommended Action: Practice self-forgiveness and understand that mistakes are part of human experience.
    Reference: Letting Go: The Pathway of Surrender by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 50: Apathy
    Emotion: Despair
    Life View: Hopeless
    Description: Marked by feelings of helplessness and a lack of energy. Individuals may feel indifferent and disconnected from life.
    Recommended Action: Engage in small, manageable activities to build momentum and seek social support.
    Reference: Healing and Recovery by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 75: Grief
    Emotion: Regret
    Life View: Tragic
    Description: Characterized by sadness and loss. Individuals may experience prolonged mourning and a sense of longing.
    Recommended Action: Allow yourself to process emotions and seek counseling if needed.
    Reference: Transcending the Levels of Consciousness by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 100: Fear
    Emotion: Anxiety
    Life View: Frightening
    Description: Dominated by anxiety and worry. Individuals may feel threatened and engage in avoidance behaviors.
    Recommended Action: Practice mindfulness and confront fears gradually to reduce their power.
    Reference: Letting Go: The Pathway of Surrender by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 125: Desire
    Emotion: Craving
    Life View: Disappointing
    Description: Driven by longing and ambition. Individuals may feel unfulfilled and constantly seek external validation.
    Recommended Action: Focus on inner fulfillment and practice gratitude for present circumstances.
    Reference: Power vs. Force by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 150: Anger
    Emotion: Hate
    Life View: Antagonistic
    Description: Characterized by frustration and resentment. Individuals may have a confrontational attitude and blame others.
    Recommended Action: Channel anger into constructive outlets and practice empathy.
    Reference: Healing and Recovery by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 175: Pride
    Emotion: Scorn
    Life View: Demanding
    Description: Marked by arrogance and denial. Individuals may have an inflated sense of self and look down on others.
    Recommended Action: Cultivate humility and recognize the value in others.
    Reference: Transcending the Levels of Consciousness by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 200: Courage
    Emotion: Affirmation
    Life View: Feasible
    Description: Characterized by empowerment and determination. Individuals take proactive steps and face challenges head-on.
    Recommended Action: Set achievable goals and embrace personal growth.
    Reference: Power vs. Force by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 250: Neutrality
    Emotion: Trust
    Life View: Satisfactory
    Description: A balanced state where one is nonjudgmental and open. Individuals feel content and at ease with life.
    Recommended Action: Maintain a non-reactive attitude, focusing on equanimity and acceptance.
    Reference: Power vs. Force by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 310: Willingness
    Emotion: Optimism
    Life View: Hopeful
    Description: Individuals are open to growth and eager to contribute. They see possibilities and are proactive.
    Recommended Action: Set positive intentions and focus on opportunities for improvement.
    Reference: Letting Go: The Pathway of Surrender by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 350: Acceptance
    Emotion: Forgiveness
    Life View: Harmonious
    Description: Marked by the ability to embrace reality as it is, fostering peace and compassion.
    Recommended Action: Practice acceptance and let go of judgment.
    Reference: Healing and Recovery by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 400: Reason
    Emotion: Understanding
    Life View: Meaningful
    Description: Rational, objective thinking defines this level. Individuals seek truth and meaning through knowledge.
    Recommended Action: Engage in intellectual pursuits and embrace curiosity.
    Reference: Power vs. Force by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 500: Love
    Emotion: Reverence
    Life View: Benign
    Description: A state of unconditional love and compassion. Individuals are forgiving, nurturing, and understanding.
    Recommended Action: Cultivate compassion and seek to understand others.
    Reference: Transcending the Levels of Consciousness by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 540: Joy
    Emotion: Serenity
    Life View: Complete
    Description: A state of profound peace and happiness, where everything is seen as interconnected.
    Recommended Action: Embrace a sense of unity and gratitude.
    Reference: Power vs. Force by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 600: Peace
    Emotion: Bliss
    Life View: Perfect
    Description: A state of transcendental peace, where one feels complete unity with all.
    Recommended Action: Engage in deep meditation and let go of attachments.
    Reference: Transcending the Levels of Consciousness by David R. Hawkins
  • Level 700-1000: Enlightenment
    Emotion: Ineffable
    Life View: Is
    Description: Pure consciousness beyond duality. A state of complete awareness and oneness with existence.
    Recommended Action: Embrace surrender and pure being.
    Reference: Power vs. Force by David R. Hawkins

pages.Title: Bashars Teachings
pages.Description: What Bashar teaches...
pages.Body:
What Bashar teaches on raising one's consciousness. [[Consciousness Speedrunning]]
  • Teaching 1: Follow Your Highest Excitement
    Description: Following your highest excitement in each moment is your compass to living in alignment with your true self. By doing what excites you, you connect with the most fulfilling path.
    Suggested Practice: Identify what excites you the most right now. Take a step toward it, no matter how small, and trust it will lead you to new opportunities.
    Reference: Bashar: Blueprint for Change by Darryl Anka
  • Teaching 2: The Five Universal Laws
    Description: These five laws govern existence, providing a framework for understanding reality and personal responsibility:
    1. You exist.
    2. The One is All, and the All are One.
    3. What you put out is what you get back.
    4. The only constant is change, except the first three laws.
    5. Everything exists here and now.
    Suggested Practice: Reflect on these laws and consider how they influence your perception of reality. Apply the law of "What you put out is what you get back" by embodying positivity.
    Reference: Bashar: The Five Universal Laws (Teaching Series)
  • Teaching 3: Reality is a Reflection
    Description: Reality acts as a mirror, reflecting back your beliefs, thoughts, emotions, and vibration. To change your experience, change your inner state first.
    Suggested Practice: Observe an area of life you wish to improve. Identify any limiting beliefs, and consciously replace them with positive affirmations aligned with your desired reality.
    Reference: Bashar: You Are the Mirror (Teaching Series)
  • Teaching 4: Parallel Realities
    Description: Infinite parallel realities exist, and every decision places you in a new one. Your vibration, beliefs, and choices constantly shift you through realities.
    Suggested Practice: Visualize a reality you want to experience. Align your thoughts, feelings, and actions with this reality and notice subtle shifts in your life.
    Reference: Bashar: The Infinite Parallel Reality (Lecture Series)
  • Teaching 5: Permission Slips
    Description: "Permission slips" are tools or beliefs that help you align your energy with desired outcomes. They serve as symbols that facilitate change by giving you “permission” to shift.
    Suggested Practice: Identify a ritual or object that helps you feel empowered. Use it consciously to focus your energy and intentions on a specific goal or state.
    Reference: Bashar: Permission Slips (Teaching Series)
  • Teaching 6: The Power of Now
    Description: Everything exists in the present. Past and future are constructs of consciousness. True power lies in focusing on the here and now.
    Suggested Practice: Engage in mindfulness or meditation to bring yourself fully into the present moment. Let go of worries about the past or future and focus on what excites you now.
    Reference: Bashar: The Power of Now (Teaching Series)
  • Teaching 7: Embrace Change and the Unknown
    Description: Change and uncertainty are opportunities for growth. Embracing the unknown allows for greater expansion and alignment with your highest potential.
    Suggested Practice: When faced with uncertainty, pause and breathe. Instead of resisting, visualize potential opportunities that change may bring.
    Reference: Bashar: Embracing Change (Teaching Series)
  • Teaching 8: Vibrational Frequency and Attraction
    Description: Everything has a vibrational frequency. By aligning your frequency with what you desire (through positive beliefs and actions), you attract similar experiences.
    Suggested Practice: Choose an uplifting thought or affirmation and repeat it throughout the day, focusing on raising your emotional vibration.
    Reference: Bashar: The Law of Attraction (Lecture Series)
  • Teaching 9: The Holistic Nature of Reality
    Description: Physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual aspects of self are interconnected. Balancing these areas creates harmony and alignment with your higher self.
    Suggested Practice: Take time daily to check in with your physical, emotional, mental, and spiritual health. Adjust where necessary to maintain balance.
    Reference: Bashar: Body-Mind-Spirit Alignment (Lecture Series)
  • Teaching 10: The Role of Beliefs and Definitions
    Description: Your definitions shape your experience of reality. Changing limiting beliefs allows you to access new levels of joy, abundance, and understanding.
    Suggested Practice: Identify a belief that limits you. Write a new, empowering belief to replace it, and practice thinking and acting from this new perspective.
    Reference: Bashar: Redefining Beliefs (Teaching Series)
  • Teaching 11: Trust the Process and Let Go
    Description: Letting go of the need to control outcomes and trusting the flow leads to smoother experiences. This openness can result in outcomes better than expected.
    Suggested Practice: When you feel anxious about a situation, visualize surrendering it to the universe. Trust that the best outcome will unfold and release attachment.
    Reference: Bashar: Surrendering and Trusting (Teaching Series)
[[Sign Posts]]

pages.Title: Heartmath institute Techniques
pages.Description: Heartmath tools...
pages.Body:
Heartmath tools that have been proven to help build a strong mind body connection.

  • Quick Coherence Technique
    Purpose: Quickly shift from stress to calm by aligning heart, mind, and emotions.
    Typical Sensations: Warmth, ease, centeredness in the chest area.
    Activation: Focus on the heart area and breathe slowly. Visualize your breath moving in and out of your heart. Then, recall a positive feeling or memory, like appreciation or joy.
    Deactivation: Gradually release the positive feeling while maintaining a gentle awareness of the heart area.
    Recommended Resource: The HeartMath Solution by Doc Childre and Howard Martin
  • Heart-Focused Breathing
    Purpose: Calm the nervous system and bring awareness to the present moment.
    Typical Sensations: Slow, rhythmic breathing, warmth in the chest.
    Activation: Direct your attention to your heart and imagine breathing through your heart. Breathe deeply but naturally, maintaining focus on the gentle rhythm.
    Deactivation: Let go of focused breathing and allow it to return to its natural flow, keeping a sense of calm and connection.
    Recommended Resource: Heart Intelligence by Doc Childre et al.
  • Inner-Ease Technique
    Purpose: Ease emotional tension, balance thoughts, and bring focus.
    Typical Sensations: Lightness, clarity, relaxation in the chest.
    Activation: Focus on the heart and breathe deeply. On each exhale, say “ease” in your mind, and feel a sense of inner relaxation spreading from the heart.
    Deactivation: Allow your breath to return to normal while keeping the sensation of ease within you.
    Recommended Resource: HeartMath’s Inner Balance App for guided practice
  • Freeze-Frame Technique
    Purpose: Reduce stress and find intuitive solutions to challenging situations.
    Typical Sensations: Calm focus, warmth in the heart, relaxation.
    Activation: When faced with a stressor, mentally "freeze" the scene. Focus on your heart and imagine breathing through it. Recall a positive feeling and then ask your heart for guidance on the situation.
    Deactivation: Gently shift your attention back to the external world, maintaining a sense of calm and clarity.
    Recommended Resource: The HeartMath Solution by Doc Childre and Howard Martin
  • Attitude Breathing
    Purpose: Transform negative emotions by consciously choosing new attitudes.
    Typical Sensations: Lighter mood, increased energy, openness in the chest.
    Activation: Focus on the heart, and on each inhale, imagine breathing in a positive attitude (like courage or compassion). On the exhale, release any stress or negativity.
    Deactivation: Allow your breath to return to normal, carrying forward the positive attitude.
    Recommended Resource: Transforming Stress by Doc Childre and Deborah Rozman
  • Coherent Communication
    Purpose: Improve understanding and emotional connection during communication.
    Typical Sensations: Calm focus, empathy, ease in expressing yourself.
    Activation: Before a conversation, focus on your heart and breathe deeply. Set an intention to listen fully and respond with clarity and kindness.
    Deactivation: Release the focused breathing and carry forward the intention of understanding into the conversation.
    Recommended Resource: Heart Intelligence by Doc Childre et al.
  • Heart Lock-In
    Purpose: Increase overall resilience and emotional stability by amplifying positive emotions.
    Typical Sensations: Deep warmth in the chest, calm, uplifted mood.
    Activation: Focus on your heart and breathe deeply, bringing to mind a positive emotion. Let this feeling expand with each breath, filling your body.
    Deactivation: Gently release focused breathing, allowing the positive energy to remain with you.
    Recommended Resource: The HeartMath Solution by Doc Childre and Howard Martin
